title: Authors and Citation
text: Sam Parmar. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Parmar S (2023). redacted: Data Redaction Masking Utility Package. R package version 0.1.0, https://parmsam.github.io/redacted/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {redacted: Data Redaction and Masking Utility Package},   author = {Sam Parmar},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://parmsam.github.io/redacted/}, }

what: Data Redaction and Masking Utility Package
title: Data Redaction and Masking Utility Package
text: goal redacted easily redact sensitive data strings. package provides set utility functions masking sensitive information text data. includes functions redacting credit card numbers, phone numbers, sensitive information using regular expressions, well utility function general masking.

title: Data Redaction and Masking Utility Package
text: can install development version redacted GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("parmsam/redacted")

title: Data Redaction and Masking Utility Package
text: basic example shows solve common problem: also redact multiple instances sensitive information string replace custom string using replace_with option pass single character * replace_with, matched string replaced asterisks length matched string can also use redact_pattern() function redact custom pattern text redact_all() attempt redact using underlying redact_*() functions defined list functions Note redact_*()functions built using stringr::str_replace_all() can use vector strings
code: library(redacted)  ## basic example code text <- "My IP address is 192.168.0.1. Please don't share it with anyone." redacted_text <- redact_ip_addresses(text) cat(redacted_text) #> My IP address is [REDACTED]. Please don't share it with anyone.  text <- "Hello, my email address is john.doe@gmail.com. Please don't share it with anyone." redacted_text <- redact_email_addresses(text) cat(redacted_text) #> Hello, my email address is [REDACTED]. Please don't share it with anyone. text <- "My PIN is 1234. Your PIN is 4321." redacted_text <- redact_pins(text) cat(redacted_text) #> My PIN is [REDACTED]. Your PIN is [REDACTED]. text <- "My PIN is 1234. Your PIN is 4321." redact_pins(text, replace_with = "[PIN REDACTED]") #> [1] "My PIN is [PIN REDACTED]. Your PIN is [PIN REDACTED]." cat(redacted_text) #> My PIN is [REDACTED]. Your PIN is [REDACTED]. text <- "My PIN is 1234. Your PIN is 4321." redacted_text <- redact_pins(text, replace_with = "*") cat(redacted_text) #> My PIN is ****. Your PIN is ****.  text <- "My PIN is 1234. Your PIN is 4321." redacted_text <- redact_pins(text, replace_with = "#") cat(redacted_text) #> My PIN is ####. Your PIN is ####. # Redact email addresses from a string text <- "Contact me at john@example.com" redacted_text <- redact_pattern(text, pattern = "\\S+@\\S+") cat(redacted_text) #> Contact me at [REDACTED] text <- c("My phone number is 555-555-1234. My email is john@example.com") redacted_text <- redact_all(text) cat(redacted_text) #> My phone number is [REDACTED]. My email is [REDACTED] redacted_text <- redact_all(text, redact_funcs = list(redacted::redact_phone_numbers, redacted::redact_ip_addresses)) cat(redacted_text) #> My phone number is [REDACTED]. My email is john@example.com text <- c("My PIN is 1234.", "Your PIN is 4321.", "Their PIN is 1111.") redacted_text <- redact_pins(text) cat(redacted_text) #> My PIN is [REDACTED]. Your PIN is [REDACTED]. Their PIN is [REDACTED].

title: Data Redaction and Masking Utility Package
text: Contributions welcome! Please open issue report bug suggest new feature, submit pull request contribute code changes.

title: Data Redaction and Masking Utility Package
text: Hex icon created using hexmake app ColinFay. Highlighter icons created Smashicons - Flaticon

what: Get a list of all redact functions in the package — default_redact_functions
title: Get a list of all redact functions in the package — default_redact_functions
text: function returns character vector names redact functions defined redacted package.

title: Get a list of all redact functions in the package — default_redact_functions
code: default_redact_functions()

title: Get a list of all redact functions in the package — default_redact_functions
text: character vector names redact functions.

title: Get a list of all redact functions in the package — default_redact_functions
code: default_redact_functions() #> $redact_credit_card_numbers #> function (text, replace_with = NULL)  #> { #>     pattern <- "\\b(?:\\d[ -]*?){13,16}\\b" #>     redact_pattern(text, pattern, replace_with) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x55cae178aa20> #> <environment: namespace:redacted> #>  #> $redact_email_addresses #> function (text, replace_with = NULL)  #> { #>     pattern <- "\\b[A-Za-z0-9._%+-]+@[A-Za-z0-9.-]+\\.[A-Za-z]{2,}(?:\\.[A-Za-z]{2,})?\\b" #>     redact_pattern(text, pattern, replace_with) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x55cae178b858> #> <environment: namespace:redacted> #>  #> $redact_ip_addresses #> function (text, replace_with = NULL)  #> { #>     pattern <- "\\b(?:\\d{1,3}\\.){3}\\d{1,3}\\b" #>     redact_pattern(text, pattern, replace_with) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x55cae1786ac8> #> <environment: namespace:redacted> #>  #> $redact_phone_numbers #> function (text, replace_with = NULL)  #> { #>     pattern <- "\\(\\d{3}\\) \\d{3}-\\d{4}|\\d{3}-\\d{3}-\\d{4}|\\d{10}" #>     redact_pattern(text, pattern, replace_with) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x55cae1787a50> #> <environment: namespace:redacted> #>  #> $redact_pins #> function (text, replace_with = NULL)  #> { #>     pattern <- "\\b\\d{4}\\b" #>     redact_pattern(text, pattern, replace_with) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x55cae1788818> #> <environment: namespace:redacted> #>  #> $redact_social_security_numbers #> function (text, replace_with = NULL)  #> { #>     pattern <- "\\b\\d{3}-\\d{2}-\\d{4}\\b" #>     redact_pattern(text, pattern, replace_with) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x55cae1785820> #> <environment: namespace:redacted> #>  #> $redact_website_urls #> function (text, replace_with = NULL)  #> { #>     pattern <- "(https?://)?(www\\.)?[a-z0-9]+([\\-\\.]{1}[a-z0-9]+)*\\.[a-z]{2,5}(:[0-9]{1,5})?([/?#][^\\s]*)?" #>     redact_pattern(text, pattern, replace_with) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x55cae1786850> #> <environment: namespace:redacted> #>

what: Redact sensitive information from a vector of strings — redact_all
title: Redact sensitive information from a vector of strings — redact_all
text: function redacts sensitive information, email addresses, phone numbers, IP addresses, domains, vector strings. uses `redact_*` family functions perform redaction.

title: Redact sensitive information from a vector of strings — redact_all
code: redact_all(   text,   redact_funcs = default_redact_functions(),   replace_with = NULL )

title: Redact sensitive information from a vector of strings — redact_all
text: text character vector text redacted. redact_funcs list redaction functions applied text. function take character vector input return character vector sensitive information redacted. Default set currently defined `redact_*` functions. replace_with string replace sensitive information . default "[REDACTED]".

title: Redact sensitive information from a vector of strings — redact_all
text: character vector sensitive information redacted.

title: Redact sensitive information from a vector of strings — redact_all
code: text <- c("My phone number is 555-555-1234", "My email is john@example.com") redact_all(text) #> [1] "My phone number is [REDACTED]" "My email is [REDACTED]"        redact_all(text, redact_funcs = list(redacted::redact_phone_numbers, redacted::redact_ip_addresses)) #> [1] "My phone number is [REDACTED]" "My email is john@example.com"

what: Redact credit card numbers in text — redact_credit_card_numbers
title: Redact credit card numbers in text — redact_credit_card_numbers
text: function redacts credit card numbers given text replacing   specified string.

title: Redact credit card numbers in text — redact_credit_card_numbers
code: redact_credit_card_numbers(text, replace_with = NULL)

title: Redact credit card numbers in text — redact_credit_card_numbers
text: text text credit card numbers redacted. replace_with string replace credit card numbers . can either whole word like "[REDACTED]", single character like "*" gets repeated based long credit card number detected . Default NULL, uses default value specified `replace_pattern()` function.

title: Redact credit card numbers in text — redact_credit_card_numbers
text: character vector credit card numbers redacted.

title: Redact credit card numbers in text — redact_credit_card_numbers
code: text <- "My credit card number is 1234 5678 9012 3456. Please don't share it with anyone." redacted_text <- redact_credit_card_numbers(text) cat(redacted_text) #> My credit card number is [REDACTED]. Please don't share it with anyone.

what: Redact email addresses in text — redact_email_addresses
title: Redact email addresses in text — redact_email_addresses
text: function redacts email addresses given text replacing specified string.

title: Redact email addresses in text — redact_email_addresses
code: redact_email_addresses(text, replace_with = NULL)

title: Redact email addresses in text — redact_email_addresses
text: text text email addresses redacted. replace_with string replace email addresses . can either whole word pattern single character. Default NULL, uses default value specified `replace_pattern()` function.

title: Redact email addresses in text — redact_email_addresses
text: character vector redacted email addresses.

title: Redact email addresses in text — redact_email_addresses
code: text <- "Hello, my email address is john.doe@gmail.com. Please don't share it with anyone." redacted_text <- redact_email_addresses(text) cat(redacted_text) #> Hello, my email address is [REDACTED]. Please don't share it with anyone.

what: Redact IP addresses in text — redact_ip_addresses
title: Redact IP addresses in text — redact_ip_addresses
text: function redacts IP addresses given text replacing specified string.

title: Redact IP addresses in text — redact_ip_addresses
code: redact_ip_addresses(text, replace_with = NULL)

title: Redact IP addresses in text — redact_ip_addresses
text: text text IP addresses redacted. replace_with string replace IP addresses . can either whole word pattern single character. Default NULL, uses default value specified `replace_pattern()` function.

title: Redact IP addresses in text — redact_ip_addresses
text: character vector redacted IP addresses.

title: Redact IP addresses in text — redact_ip_addresses
code: text <- "My IP address is 192.168.0.1. Please don't share it with anyone." redacted_text <- redact_ip_addresses(text) cat(redacted_text) #> My IP address is [REDACTED]. Please don't share it with anyone.

what: Redact sensitive patterns in text — redact_pattern
title: Redact sensitive patterns in text — redact_pattern
text: function replaces sensitive patterns text specified replacement string, default "[REDACTED]".

title: Redact sensitive patterns in text — redact_pattern
code: redact_pattern(text, pattern, replace_with = NULL)

title: Redact sensitive patterns in text — redact_pattern
text: text character string containing text redact pattern character string specifying regular expression pattern search replace_with character string specifying replacement text use. NULL (default), sensitive pattern replaced "[REDACTED]".

title: Redact sensitive patterns in text — redact_pattern
text: character string sensitive patterns replaced specified replacement string

title: Redact sensitive patterns in text — redact_pattern
code: redact_pattern("My password is password123", "\\bpassword\\d*\\b") #> [1] "My [REDACTED] is [REDACTED]" redact_pattern("My API key is 1234-5678-9012-3456", "\\d{4}-\\d{4}-\\d{4}-\\d{4}", "[REDACTED]") #> [1] "My API key is [REDACTED]"

what: Redact phone numbers in text — redact_phone_numbers
title: Redact phone numbers in text — redact_phone_numbers
text: function redacts phone numbers given text replacing specified string.

title: Redact phone numbers in text — redact_phone_numbers
code: redact_phone_numbers(text, replace_with = NULL)

title: Redact phone numbers in text — redact_phone_numbers
text: text text phone numbers redacted. replace_with string replace phone numbers . can either whole word like "[REDACTED]", single character like "*" gets repeated based long phone number detected . Default NULL, uses default value specified `replace_pattern()` function.

title: Redact phone numbers in text — redact_phone_numbers
text: character vector phone numbers redacted.

title: Redact phone numbers in text — redact_phone_numbers
code: text <- "My phone number is (123) 456-7890. Please don't share it with anyone." redacted_text <- redact_phone_numbers(text) cat(redacted_text) #> My phone number is [REDACTED]. Please don't share it with anyone.

what: Redact 4 digit pins from a string — redact_pins
title: Redact 4 digit pins from a string — redact_pins
text: function takes string replaces occurrences 4 digit pin

title: Redact 4 digit pins from a string — redact_pins
code: redact_pins(text, replace_with = NULL)

title: Redact 4 digit pins from a string — redact_pins
text: text character string. replace_with character string replace matched pattern . NULL, defaults "[REDACTED]".

title: Redact 4 digit pins from a string — redact_pins
text: input string 4 digit pins replaced [REDACTED].

title: Redact 4 digit pins from a string — redact_pins
code: redact_pins("My pin is 1234") #> [1] "My pin is [REDACTED]" redact_pins("Her PIN is 9876") #> [1] "Her PIN is [REDACTED]"

what: Redact social security numbers in text — redact_social_security_numbers
title: Redact social security numbers in text — redact_social_security_numbers
text: function redacts social security numbers given text replacing specified string.

title: Redact social security numbers in text — redact_social_security_numbers
code: redact_social_security_numbers(text, replace_with = NULL)

title: Redact social security numbers in text — redact_social_security_numbers
text: text text social security numbers redacted. replace_with string replace social security numbers . can either whole word like "[REDACTED]", single character like "*" gets repeated based long social security number detected . Default NULL, uses default value specified `replace_pattern()` function.

title: Redact social security numbers in text — redact_social_security_numbers
text: character vector social security numbers redacted.

title: Redact social security numbers in text — redact_social_security_numbers
code: text <- "My social security number is 123-45-6789. Please don't share it with anyone." redacted_text <- redact_social_security_numbers(text) cat(redacted_text) #> My social security number is [REDACTED]. Please don't share it with anyone.

what: Redact website URLs in a text string — redact_website_urls
title: Redact website URLs in a text string — redact_website_urls
text: function searches text string website URLs replaces specified value default value "[REDACTED]".

title: Redact website URLs in a text string — redact_website_urls
code: redact_website_urls(text, replace_with = NULL)

title: Redact website URLs in a text string — redact_website_urls
text: text character string containing text searched redacted replace_with character string specifies value replace matched domains . argument specified, default value "[REDACTED]" used.

title: Redact website URLs in a text string — redact_website_urls
text: character string matched domains replaced specified default value

title: Redact website URLs in a text string — redact_website_urls
code: text <- "Visit our website at www.example.com for more information." redact_website_urls(text) #> [1] "Visit our website at [REDACTED] for more information."

title: Replace pattern in text — replace_pattern
text: function replaces specified pattern given text specified string.

title: Replace pattern in text — replace_pattern
code: replace_pattern(text, pattern, replace_with = "[REDACTED]")

title: Replace pattern in text — replace_pattern
text: text text pattern replaced. pattern pattern replace text. replace_with string replace pattern .

title: Replace pattern in text — replace_pattern
text: character vector pattern replaced.
